speaker: Clown
text_entry: SCENE III. A chapel in PAULINA'S house.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Enter LEONTES, POLIXENES, FLORIZEL, PERDITA, CAMILLO, PAULINA, Lords, and Attendants

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: O grave and good Paulina, the great comfort

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: That I have had of thee!

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: What, sovereign sir,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: I did not well I meant well. All my services

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: You have paid home: but that you have vouchsafed,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: With your crown'd brother and these your contracted

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Heirs of your kingdoms, my poor house to visit,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: It is a surplus of your grace, which never

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: My life may last to answer.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: O Paulina,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: We honour you with trouble: but we came

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: To see the statue of our queen: your gallery

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Have we pass'd through, not without much content

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: In many singularities; but we saw not

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: That which my daughter came to look upon,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: The statue of her mother.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: As she lived peerless,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: So her dead likeness, I do well believe,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Excels whatever yet you look'd upon

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Or hand of man hath done; therefore I keep it

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Lonely, apart. But here it is: prepare

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: To see the life as lively mock'd as ever

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Still sleep mock'd death: behold, and say 'tis well.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: PAULINA draws a curtain, and discovers HERMIONE standing like a statue

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: I like your silence, it the more shows off

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Your wonder: but yet speak; first, you, my liege,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Comes it not something near?

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Her natural posture!

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Chide me, dear stone, that I may say indeed

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Thou art Hermione; or rather, thou art she

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: In thy not chiding, for she was as tender

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: As infancy and grace. But yet, Paulina,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Hermione was not so much wrinkled, nothing

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: So aged as this seems.

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: O, not by much.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: So much the more our carver's excellence;

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Which lets go by some sixteen years and makes her

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: As she lived now.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: As now she might have done,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: So much to my good comfort, as it is

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Now piercing to my soul. O, thus she stood,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Even with such life of majesty, warm life,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: As now it coldly stands, when first I woo'd her!

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: I am ashamed: does not the stone rebuke me

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: For being more stone than it? O royal piece,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: There's magic in thy majesty, which has

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: My evils conjured to remembrance and

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: From thy admiring daughter took the spirits,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Standing like stone with thee.

speaker: PERDITA
text_entry: And give me leave,

speaker: PERDITA
text_entry: And do not say 'tis superstition, that

speaker: PERDITA
text_entry: I kneel and then implore her blessing. Lady,

speaker: PERDITA
text_entry: Dear queen, that ended when I but began,

speaker: PERDITA
text_entry: Give me that hand of yours to kiss.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: O, patience!

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: The statue is but newly fix'd, the colour's Not dry.

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: My lord, your sorrow was too sore laid on,

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Which sixteen winters cannot blow away,

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: So many summers dry; scarce any joy

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Did ever so long live; no sorrow

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: But kill'd itself much sooner.

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Dear my brother,

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Let him that was the cause of this have power

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: To take off so much grief from you as he

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Will piece up in himself.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Indeed, my lord,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: If I had thought the sight of my poor image

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Would thus have wrought you,--for the stone is mine--

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: I'ld not have show'd it.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Do not draw the curtain.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: No longer shall you gaze on't, lest your fancy

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: May think anon it moves.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Let be, let be.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Would I were dead, but that, methinks, already--

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: What was he that did make it? See, my lord,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Would you not deem it breathed? and that those veins

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Did verily bear blood?

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Masterly done:

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: The very life seems warm upon her lip.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: The fixture of her eye has motion in't,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: As we are mock'd with art.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: I'll draw the curtain:

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: My lord's almost so far transported that

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: He'll think anon it lives.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: O sweet Paulina,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Make me to think so twenty years together!

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: No settled senses of the world can match

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: The pleasure of that madness. Let 't alone.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: I am sorry, sir, I have thus far stirr'd you: but

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: I could afflict you farther.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Do, Paulina;

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: For this affliction has a taste as sweet

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: As any cordial comfort. Still, methinks,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: There is an air comes from her: what fine chisel

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Could ever yet cut breath? Let no man mock me,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: For I will kiss her.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Good my lord, forbear:

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: The ruddiness upon her lip is wet;

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: You'll mar it if you kiss it, stain your own

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: With oily painting. Shall I draw the curtain?

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: No, not these twenty years.

speaker: PERDITA
text_entry: So long could I

speaker: PERDITA
text_entry: Stand by, a looker on.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Either forbear,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Quit presently the chapel, or resolve you

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: For more amazement. If you can behold it,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: I'll make the statue move indeed, descend

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: And take you by the hand; but then you'll think--

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Which I protest against--I am assisted

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: By wicked powers.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: What you can make her do,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: I am content to look on: what to speak,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: I am content to hear; for 'tis as easy

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: To make her speak as move.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: It is required

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: You do awake your faith. Then all stand still;

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: On: those that think it is unlawful business

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: I am about, let them depart.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Proceed:

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: No foot shall stir.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Music, awake her; strike!

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Music

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: 'Tis time; descend; be stone no more; approach;

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Strike all that look upon with marvel. Come,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: I'll fill your grave up: stir, nay, come away,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Bequeath to death your numbness, for from him

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Dear life redeems you. You perceive she stirs:

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: HERMIONE comes down

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Start not; her actions shall be holy as

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: You hear my spell is lawful: do not shun her

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Until you see her die again; for then

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: You kill her double. Nay, present your hand:

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: When she was young you woo'd her; now in age

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Is she become the suitor?

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: O, she's warm!

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: If this be magic, let it be an art

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Lawful as eating.

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: She embraces him.

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: She hangs about his neck:

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: If she pertain to life let her speak too.

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Ay, and make't manifest where she has lived,

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Or how stolen from the dead.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: That she is living,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Were it but told you, should be hooted at

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Like an old tale: but it appears she lives,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Though yet she speak not. Mark a little while.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Please you to interpose, fair madam: kneel

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: And pray your mother's blessing. Turn, good lady;

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Our Perdita is found.

speaker: HERMIONE
text_entry: You gods, look down

speaker: HERMIONE
text_entry: And from your sacred vials pour your graces

speaker: HERMIONE
text_entry: Upon my daughter's head! Tell me, mine own.

speaker: HERMIONE
text_entry: Where hast thou been preserved? where lived? how found

speaker: HERMIONE
text_entry: Thy father's court? for thou shalt hear that I,

speaker: HERMIONE
text_entry: Knowing by Paulina that the oracle

speaker: HERMIONE
text_entry: Gave hope thou wast in being, have preserved

speaker: HERMIONE
text_entry: Myself to see the issue.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: There's time enough for that;

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Lest they desire upon this push to trouble

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Your joys with like relation. Go together,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: You precious winners all; your exultation

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Partake to every one. I, an old turtle,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Will wing me to some wither'd bough and there

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: My mate, that's never to be found again,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Lament till I am lost.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: O, peace, Paulina!

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Thou shouldst a husband take by my consent,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: As I by thine a wife: this is a match,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: And made between's by vows. Thou hast found mine;

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: But how, is to be question'd; for I saw her,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: As I thought, dead, and have in vain said many

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: A prayer upon her grave. I'll not seek far--

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: For him, I partly know his mind--to find thee

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: An honourable husband. Come, Camillo,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: And take her by the hand, whose worth and honesty

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Is richly noted and here justified

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: By us, a pair of kings. Let's from this place.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: What! look upon my brother: both your pardons,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: That e'er I put between your holy looks

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: My ill suspicion. This is your son-in-law,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: And son unto the king, who, heavens directing,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Is troth-plight to your daughter. Good Paulina,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Lead us from hence, where we may leisurely

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Each one demand an answer to his part

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Perform'd in this wide gap of time since first

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: We were dissever'd: hastily lead away.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Exeunt
